p: The age 31–40 years (OR = 3.423, 95% CI: 1.360–8.615), 41–50 years (OR = 4.809, 95% CI: 1.869–12.375), and >50 years (OR = 2.949, 95% CI: 1.103–7.881) were the higher risk factors and transmission routes compared to <20 years. Compared to homosexual transmission, heterosexual transmission (OR = 0.549, 95% CI: 0.382–0.789) and intravenous drug use (OR = 0.298, 95% CI: 0.112–0.793) were lower risk factors for syphilis infection in HIV-positive individuals ( Table 5).
